title: National Heritage Conservation Commission (Nalupembe Falls) (National Monument) (Declaration) Order, 2023
content:
17th August, 2023 Statutory Instruments 195
GOVERNMENT OF ZAMBIA
STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NO. 28 OF 2023
The National Heritage Conservation Commission Act
(Laws, Volume 12, Cap 173)
The National Heritage Conservation Commission
(Nalupembe Falls) (National Monument) ( Declaration)
Order, 2023
IN EXERCISE of the powers contained in section 27 of the National
Heritage Conservation Commission Act, the following Order is
made:
1. This Order may be cited as the National Heritage
Title
Conservation Commission (Nalupembe Falls) (National Monument)
(Declaration) Order, 2023.
2. The heritage described in the Schedule is declared a national Declaration
monument. of national
monument
Copies of this Statutory Instrument can be obtained from the Government Printer,
P.O. Box 30136, 10101 Lusaka. Price K 4.00 each.
196 Statutory Instruments 17th August, 2023
SCHEDULE
(Paragraph 2)
NALUPEMBE FALLS
LOCATION
The site is located in Kalundu Village in Mwenda Chiefdom, Chipili District on Mumbwe
River in Luapula Province. The site is situated at latitudes and longitudes -10.728720S,
29.093417E (10°43’43.4’’S, 29°05’36.3’’E) and 10.729484°S, 29.09442E (10°43’46.1’’S,
29°05’39.9’’E) respectively, and covering a total area of 342,109.73m_.
STATEMENT OF SIGNIFICANCE
The site is the largest and most scenic waterfall in Chipili District. The site is located a few
meters downstream of the Mumbwe River Bridge crossing in the heart of Chipili Township.
BOUNDARY DESCRIPTION
The boundary of the site runs from Point A on the northern-eastern bank of Mumbwe River
and in a south-easterly direction to Point B near a bush truck and further to points C, D and E near
the main road at the bridge; thence cutting through the Mumbwe Rriver taking a south-westerly
direction to Point F on the southern side of the Mumbwe River; thence in a north-westerly
direction to Points G, H and I and in a north-easterly direction to Point A the starting point after
cutting through the Mumbwe River.
The described area is in extent of 342.1 hectares.
The described area is shown on a plan marked red, signed by the Surveyor-General and
deposited in the office of the Surveyor-General and the National Heritage Conservation
Commission, Lusaka.
R. SIKUMBA,
LUSAKA Minister of Tourism
11th August, 2023
(MOT.13/7/1)
